alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; King and Queen; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 12:44PM EDT until May 27 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR GLOUCESTER...SOUTHERN MIDDLESEX...SOUTHEASTERN KING AND QUEEN... NORTHWESTERN YORK...NORTHWESTERN MATHEWS...EAST CENTRAL NEW KENT AND EASTERN JAMES CITY COUNTIES... At 1244 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Glenns to near Gloucester Courthouse, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Glenns around 1250 PM EDT. Saluda around 1255 PM EDT. Urbanna around 100 PM EDT. Hartfield and Blakes around 110 PM EDT. Deltaville around 120 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Croaker, Camp Peary, Harmony Village, Grafton, Harcum, Cash, Amburg, Ewell, Greys Point and Allmondsville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for east central Virginia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; James City; King and Queen; Mathews; Middlesex; New Kent; York
